data.question: What is the chemical formula for the trimetallic magnets discussed in the paper?
What structure do the trimetallic magnets have?
What is the role of Ln(III) ions in the magnetic properties of the trimetallic magnets?
data.answer: The overall magnetic nature can be systematically controlled by Ln(III) ions inserted between the 2-D ferromagnetic layers.

data.question: What is the highest Tc reported for Prussian-blue analogue Tb[Cr(CN)6]·4H2O?
What is the Tc for the compound with Gd(III) ion?
Is the magnetic interaction between 3d and 4f metal ions generally strong?
Did the trimetallic magnets with La(III) and Gd(III) show the same type of magnetic behavior?
What is the magnetic behavior of the compound with La(III) ion?
data.answer: Metamagnetic-like behavior with Tc of 7.4 K

data.question: Are the compounds [Co2Ln(L)2(H2O)4][Cr(CN)6]·nH2O (Ln = La and Gd) isomorphous?
What is the role of the 2-D grid layer in the structure of the trimetallic magnets?
data.answer: It is extended by Cr−CN−Co linkages on the ab plane, contributing to the 3-D framework.

data.question: What is the dihedral angle between the two {LnONO} least-square planes for compound 3?
Does the presence of Gd(III) ion increase the Tc of the trimetallic magnets compared to La(III) ion?
What is the remnant magnetization of compound 4 at 2 K?
Is the magnetic interaction between Co(II) and Cr(III) ions ferromagnetic or antiferromagnetic?
What is the Weiss constant for the CoLaCo complex?
Are the two {CoO4} planes in the trinuclear unit coplanar?
What is the average dihedral angle between the two least-squares {CoO4} planes for compound 4?
Does the magnetic behavior of compounds 3 and 4 suggest that the magnetic interaction in the CoLnCo pillar unit is crucial for determining the overall magnetic phase?
What is the role of cyanide bridges in the magnetic properties of the trimetallic magnets?
data.answer: They operate a ferromagnetic interaction between Co(II) and Cr(III) ions within the two-dimensional layers.

data.question: Are the trimetallic magnets with La(III) and Gd(III) the first examples of 3-D 3d−3d−4f trimetallic magnets?
